jeopardy_round: ONE NIGHT WHEN I COULDN'T SLEEP...

(2, 1).clue: 11:30: Saw one of his Top 10 "Ways to Make 'Jeopardy!' More Exciting": "contestants... paid in black-market zoo animals"

(3, 1).clue: J.S. Bach played a mean violin but preferred this instrument with a slightly longer body & slightly shorter name

(4, 1).clue: The milk chocolate Hershey bar was introduced in 1900; a version that added these came 8 years later

(5, 1).clue: Airport traffic was a breeze & security a delight; I'm 3 hours early, so I'll take this status on an earlier flight

(6, 1).clue: Manager Danny Ozark misspoke when he said, "even Napoleon had his" this Washington apartment complex

(2, 2).clue: 12:47: Thumbed through this thriller about a young runner; Nazi dentistry always lulls me to sleep

(3, 2).clue: This composer born in 1809 was the grandson of philosopher Moses Mendelssohn

(5, 2).clue: A road for a motorist to avoid heavy traffic, or a surgical heart procedure

(6, 2).clue: In 1982 this Dodger skipper said Kurt Bevacqua "couldn't hit water if he fell out of a... boat"

(2, 3).clue: 1:58: Took my dog for a walk; he's this breed--see why I named him Michelin Man?

(2, 4).clue: 2:52: Karaoked "Chow Down" & "The Madness of King Scar" from this Broadway musical; my neighbors love me!

(3, 4).clue: You can hear why Beethoven's 1806 sonata has this Italian nickname containing the word "passion"

(4, 4).clue: In 1977 Hershey's acquired this brand of licorice, "the twist you can't resist"

(5, 4).clue: It's a standing rule governing a corporation's internal affairs

(6, 4).clue: Cito Gaston took this north of the border team to consecutive titles in 1992 & '93

(3, 5).clue: In 1696 John Blow, a great British composer of this musical era, wrote an ode on the death of another, Henry Purcell

(4, 5).clue: Products sold under this iconic brand name include the NutRageous bar & creamy peanut butter

(5, 5).clue: Found before "account", this term originated with announcers who described each punch in a boxing match

(6, 5).clue: In every year but one from 1991 to 2005, he led the Atlanta Braves to division crowns

(1, 1).clue: One of the products of the peace conference held in this city in 1919 was the Covenant of the League of Nations

(3, 1).clue: Early myth says this "mighty" goddess rose full-grown from sea foam

(4, 1).clue: She dedicated "Jane Eyre" to fellow author William Makepeace Thackeray

(5, 1).clue: "The best laid plans of ____ and men"

(6, 1).clue: (First Lady Michelle Obama presents the clue.)  Campaigning in 2008, I learned about problems of military families from jobs & education to wellness; later, I began the Joining Forces initiative to highlight the issues along with this woman whose son is in the Delaware Army National Guard

(3, 2).clue: This god was also a guide to the Underworld & for travelers; now, his name adorns expensive scarves

(5, 2).clue: "The old ____ ____, she ain't what she used to be"
